Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with healthy green leaves, showing it has enough water.
The student can draw a plant with drooping or brown leaves to show it doesn't have enough water.
The student can include the sun in their drawing to represent the plant's need for light to grow.
The student can represent different kinds of animals that rely on plants for food.
The student can illustrate that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
